Incident.Summary: NICOLE MARIE MARSHALL - POSSESSION OF CDS: NOT MARIJUANA

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
***THIS INCIDENT WAS CAPTURED ON A BODY-WORN CAMERA-

   On 8/7/2023 at 1350hrs, Investigators from the Criminal Enforcement Division – Strategic Operations Group – Western Region were conducting criminal enforcement in Hagerstown, (Washington County) Maryland.

   At that time, Investigators observed a Red 2018 Honda CRV bearing MD registration “4EL0277” leave the area of Church Street & Jonathan Street.  This particular area is well-known to Investigators for the distribution of all types of CDS.  As the Honda traveled West on Church Street, it failed to come to a complete stop at a steady red circular signal.  The Honda stopped approx. one-half (1/2) of the vehicle’s length across the white stop line.

   Investigators followed the Honda as it traveled from Church Street to Salem Avenue.  Once on Salem Avenue, Investigators activated their emergency equipment, including audible siren and conducted the traffic stop prior to Stratford Avenue.

   MT Talbert approached the driver’s side of the Honda with Sgt Smith assisting on the passenger side.  Two (2) females were identified via their MD-issued driver’s license / ID card as follows:

-Driver: Heather Marie Davis (DOB: 9/10/1982 – W/F)
-Front Seat Passenger: Nicole Renee Marshall (DOB: 10/24/1983 – W/F)

   An unnamed elderly female was also present in the back seat.  A number of criminal indicators were observed and a K-9 scan was requested.  ST Deaner and his K-9 partner, “Captain” arrived shortly after and the subsequent free-air scan produced a POSITIVE ALERT for the presence of narcotics.  A probable cause search of the vehicle revealed the following item located in Marshall’s purse:

-One (1) silver cylindrical pill container, which contained eight and one-half (8 ½) round blue pills, suspected CDS

   Marshall had a number of prescription bottles in her possession, but the blue pills did not appear to have a prescription associated with them.  In addition to the lack of a prescription, a closer examination of the pills revealed markings (“M” & “30”) consistent with Oxycodone.

   Marshall was verbally advised of her Miranda Rights, which she elected to waive at 1408hrs.  Marshall agreed to speak with Investigators freely, voluntarily, and without the presence of legal counsel.  When presented with the pills, Marshall immediately stated that they were “fake”.  This particular type of “fake” CDS is consistent with the trend of drug organizations pressing Fentanyl into pills that give the appearance of prescription Oxycodone.

   Also while speaking Marshall, I informed her that a female Deputy from the Washington County Sheriff’s Office would be arriving shortly to search her.  Marshall immediately and voluntarily retrieved a small torn white baggie from her bra and presented it to me stating that it contained Crack Cocaine.  Once the female Deputy arrived, a thorough search of both Davis and Marshall failed to produce any other contraband.  A thorough debriefing was also conducted with both Davis and Marshall before both were released from the scene.

   MT Talbert has nineteen-plus (19+) years of knowledge, training and experience in the field of enforcing Maryland’s laws concerning controlled dangerous substances (CDS).  MT Talbert has extensive knowledge and training as it relates to the manufacturing, packaging, distribution, and use of illicit controlled dangerous substances and other drugs.  MT Talbert is also an IACP certified Drug Recognition Expert / DRE Instructor.

   The suspected CDS was transported to the Maryland State Police - Hagerstown Barrack "O" for processing.  All weights / counts were verified by Sgt J. Smith #4780.  The suspected CDS was then heat sealed in a clear evidence bag and forwarded to the MSP Crime Lab for analysis.  All information was captured on an MSP Property Log (MSP Form 63) and an MSP Chain of Custody Log (MSP Form 67).

   On 9/12/2023, two (2) criminal charges were preferred in this case against the defendant, Nicole Marie Marshall.  The criminal charges were as follows:

1.) CDS Possession: Not Marijuana (Fentanyl - Schedule II)
2.) CDS Possession: Not Marijuana (Crack Cocaine - Schedule II)

   Due to the above-listed facts, this case is considered CLOSED UPON ARREST / issuance of the criminal charges on the defendant, Nicole Marie Marshall.

-All events did occur in Washington County, Maryland-

IncidentProperty.Description: EIGHT AND ONE-HALF (8.5) ROUND BLUE PILLS - SUSPECTED FENTANYL
WHITE ROCK SUBSTANCE - SUSPECTED CRACK COCAINE
